oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tennessee State Guard Act
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Publication of the Adjutant General's Office of Chapter 15, Public Acts of 1941 that called for the creation of the Guard, along with the amendments to the Act through 1945. Amendment references appear in bold.

Senate Bill III, 1941 called for the creation of the Tennessee State Guard. Governor Prentice Cooper would sign the Public Act of 1941 on January 30, 1941 this legislation combined with an Executive Order issued by Governor Cooper on March 18, 1941 brought the Guard into being.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: State of Tennessee, Office of the Adjutant General
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Tennessee. Militia; Tennessee - History, Military; World War, 1939-1945
Militias
